intro: Cota triumfetti subsp. triumfetti, commonly known as the common cota, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring erect, branching stems. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands.
